</image>   <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;34eed833.1503">   <title>Atmospheres Conference, 1-2 July 2015, University of Manchester - REGISTRATION NOW OPEN </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;34eed833.1503</link>   <description> Registration is now open for our forthcoming Atmospheres Conference.<br><br>Atmospheres play a significant role in, and add an important quality to, our intimate, domestic and public lives, yet are often overlooked in social research, not least because of the methodological challenges involved in 'capturing' them.<br>In this major conference celebrating the 10th anniversary of the Morgan Centre, we will be using the theme of 'atmospheres' as our starting point for interdisciplinary dialogue. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-12T11:16:20+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Victoria Higham</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;34eed833.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;b2e20e9d.1503">   <title>Copyright Study Day </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;b2e20e9d.1503</link>   <description> There are now just a few places left for 'Keeping Within the Lines: Approaches to Copyright in Art and Design Archives'<br><br>London Metropolitan Archives, London<br>Friday 13 March, 10.15am - 5pm<br><br>Organised by ARLIS/UK &amp; Ireland, Committee for Art &amp; Design Archives (CADA) in partnership with The National Archives and the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdArchiving the Arts\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd initiative. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-03T20:38:16+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>ARLIS Committee for Art and Design Archives</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;b2e20e9d.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;84c8c9e3.1502">   <title>SSSP 2015 Call for participation </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;84c8c9e3.1502</link>   <description> Sound, Sight, Space and Play (SSSP) 2015 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdsound across media\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br><br>17th -19th June 2015<br><br>Call for participation<br><br>Deadline: Monday 23rd February 2015<br><br>We would like to invite you to take part in Sound, Sight, Space and Play (SSSP) 2015,<br>a conference for postgraduate and postdoctoral students working in the sonic and media arts. The conference is organised by postgraduate students of the Music, Technology and Innovation Research Centre (MTIRC) at De Montfort University, and it aims to stimulate co-operation and inspiration between postgraduate and postdoctoral students across institutional boundaries and disciplines from music, film, performance, to art specialties such as [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-09T22:29:37+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Samuel Warren</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;84c8c9e3.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;562e17fd.1502">   <title>Call for works and papers - Conference SSSP 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;562e17fd.1502</link>   <description> \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdSound, Sight, Space and Play (SSSP) 2015 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdsound across media\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br>Conference will take place between 17-19th June 2015<br>- - -<br>Call for works and papers<br>- - -<br><br>Deadline: Monday 23rd February 2015   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-02T17:48:58+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Virginie Viel</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;562e17fd.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;a0b898e.1502">   <title>Projection/Expulsion: Strategies of Beholding Symposium </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;a0b898e.1502</link>   <description> **Apologies for any cross-posting **<br><br>Projection/Expulsion: Strategies of Beholding Symposium<br>Saturday 14 March 2015, 09.30 - 18.00<br>Lecture Theatre, Chelsea College of Arts, London, SW1P4JU<br><br>Speakers: Professor Jane Collins, Professor Catherine Elwes, Professor James Hamilton, Professor Laura U Marks, Dr Hillel Schwartz, Professor David Toop<br>Chairs: Aura Satz, Dr Ken Wilder<br><br>The symposium and accompanying exhibition aims to bring a new critical awareness to the way in which beholding is also a \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdbeing-held\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd. It will consider moving image installation and sound works where the embodied beholder is already prescribed as an implicit presence, anticipated by the work. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-02T12:58:05+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Wendy Short</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;a0b898e.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;5434b2b5.1501">   <title>ARLIS Committee for Art & Design Archives, Copyright Study Day </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;5434b2b5.1501</link>   <description> Keeping Within the Lines: Approaches to Copyright in Art and Design Archives<br><br>London Metropolitan Archives, London<br>Friday 13 March, 10.15am - 5pm<br><br>Organised by ARLIS/UK &amp; Ireland, Committee for Art &amp; Design Archives (CADA) in partnership with The National Archives and the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdArchiving the Arts\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd initiative.<br><br>A study day comprising presentations, panel discussions and a practical workshop, focusing on copyright and other legal issues in relation to the use of art and design archives. Expert speakers will explore the principles of copyright presented by current legislation and thinking, and discuss the issues, challenges and opportunities of using copyright-protected archive material [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-26T16:37:03+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>ARLIS Committee for Art & Design Archives</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;5434b2b5.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;d9f43f6a.1412">   <title>Atmospheres Conference, 1-2 July 2015, University of Manchester - CALL FOR ABSTRACTS </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;d9f43f6a.1412</link>   <description> News from the Morgan Centre for Research into Everyday Lives, University of Manchester Atmospheres, 1-2 July 2015, Call for Abstracts<br><br>Atmospheres play a significant role in, and add an important quality to, our intimate, domestic and public lives, yet are often overlooked in social research, not least because of the methodological challenges involved in \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdcapturing\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd them. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-17T11:23:42+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Victoria Higham</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;d9f43f6a.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;82a065a9.1410">   <title>TOC: Open Arts Journal, issue 3, \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdDisturbing pasts: Memories, controversies and creativity\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, Summer 2014</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;82a065a9.1410</link>   <description> Dear Subscriber,<br>We are pleased to announce the third issue of the Open Arts Journal. 'Disturbing Pasts: Memories, Controversies and Creativity' is a 220+-page, fully illustrated issue, co-edited by Elizabeth Edwards (De Montfort Leicester), Uilleam Blacker (University College London) and Leon Wainwright (Colgate, New York and The Open University, UK). It also represents the culmination of three years of international project work (including a major conference at the Weltmuseum Wien/Vienna in 2012, http://www.open.ac.uk/Arts/disturbing-pasts/ ). [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-30T15:35:09+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Tilo Reifenstein</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;82a065a9.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;20ddc3b1.1410">   <title>Call for Submissions - Re-imagining Rural Mythologies </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;20ddc3b1.1410</link>   <description> Re-imagining Rural Mythologies<br>Call for Submissions<br>6th Nordic Geographers Meeting, Tallinn &amp; Tartu, Estonia, 15 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 19 June 2015<br><br>Even in cities, encounters with the countryside texture our daily routines. Whether we buy an organic chicken sandwich at lunch-time, wash our clothes in \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdMeadow Fresh\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd fabric conditioner, or daydream about escaping the pressures of modern living amid the beauty, fresh air and tranquility of the countryside, popular perceptions of the rural permeate our lives. Yet, how do such bucolic notions hold up against reality? How, and through which processes, are rural mythologies perpetuated? How might binary perceptions of \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdrural\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd and [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-22T10:32:49+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Joanne Lee</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;20ddc3b1.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;8fdbd631.1410">   <title>Atmospheres, 1-2 July 2015, University of Manchester - CALL FOR ABSTRACTS </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;8fdbd631.1410</link>   <description> News from the Morgan Centre for Research into Everyday Lives, University of Manchester<br>Atmospheres, 1-2 July 2015, Call for Abstracts<br><br>Atmospheres play a significant role in, and add an important quality to, our intimate, domestic and public lives, yet are often overlooked in social research, not least because of the methodological challenges involved in \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdcapturing\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd them. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-09T13:45:55+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Victoria Higham</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;8fdbd631.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;5ae609d9.1410">   <title>Pre-Call for Applications: European Excellence Master in MEDIA ARTS CULTURES </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;5ae609d9.1410</link>   <description> Dear list members,<br><br>we are looking to attract submissions from the best international students for the EU-funded scholarships. Please share.   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-07T15:21:35+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Image Science</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;5ae609d9.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;4804f73c.1409">   <title>CCLAP (Cross-Cultural Live Art Project) | 31 Oct & 1 Nov 2014 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;4804f73c.1409</link>   <description> *** apologies for any cross-posting ***<br><br>*CLAPP (CROSS \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdCULTURAL LIVE ART PROJECT) 2014 *<br><br>Friday, 31st October 2014<br>11am-9.45pm<br><br>Saturday, 1st November 2014<br>11am-9.45pm<br><br>The Proud Archivist<br>2-10 Hertford Road<br>London N1 5SH<br><br>CCLAP brings together Southeast Asian and UK/European artists for a 2-day<br>symposium, showcasing performances, talks and a screening programme<br>exploring gendered/feminist notions of \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdrites\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd. Presented in partnership<br>with SEA ArtsFest, Asian Performing Arts Forum, Live Art Development Agency<br>and Romeet Contemporary Art Space. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-24T22:27:16+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Something Human</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;4804f73c.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;b14e59fc.1409">   <title>IN DIALOGUE 2014 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd programme announced 2nd \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 5th October</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;b14e59fc.1409</link>   <description> Apologies for cross posting<br><br>An International Symposium that interrogates how artists and researchers use dialogue in practice.<br>Hosted by Nottingham Contemporary, PRIMARY and Backlit in collaboration with Dance4.<br><br>http://eepurl.com/3pyeX<br><br>Guest speakers include Grant H. Kester, Gary Anderson (The Institute for the Art &amp; Practice of Dissent at Home), Fucking Good Art, Janna Graham (The Centre for Possible Studies) Rachel Marsden, John Newling, and Lorena Rivero de Beer. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-17T14:29:48+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Heather Connelly</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;b14e59fc.1409</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;d622f31a.1406">   <title>Registration now open: Ceramics in the Expanded Field, University of Westminster 17-19 July 2014 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;d622f31a.1406</link>   <description> Registration is now open for the Ceramics in the Expanded Field conference, which will be held at the University of Westminster's Marylebone Campus from 17-19 July 2014.<br><br>Ceramics in the Expanded Field \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd An International Conference<br><br>Date: 17-19 July 2014<br>University of Westminster, 35 Marylebone Rd, London NW1 5LS<br>The conference Ceramics in the Expanded Field will examine how ceramic practice has broadened over the last decade, initiating new forms of experimental practice and dialogues within the museum environment. It aims to interrogate ideas of ceramic display and intervention, and divergent forms of practice, curation and museology within \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdthe expanded [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-06-09T14:43:19+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Laura Breen</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;d622f31a.1406</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;3726434d.1405">   <title>Call for proposals for In Dialogue Symposium deadline 19th May </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;3726434d.1405</link>   <description> Apologies for cross posting<br><br>In Dialogue, 2-4 October 2014<br>An International Symposium that interrogates how artists and researchers use dialogue in practice<br><br>In Dialogue 2014 is a series of interdisciplinary events including presentations, discussions, communal meals, open mic sessions, live music and performance/live art showcases taking place across Nottingham. Our aim is to create a dialogue between the different applications and understandings of the term 'In Dialogue', considering differences, commonalities, and how diverse approaches to understanding and articulating the theme can lead to new ways of thinking and making. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-05-12T20:38:33+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Heather Connelly</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;3726434d.1405</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;98b8c229.1405">   <title>Archivist as Curator Study Day, 9 June, White Cube </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;98b8c229.1405</link>   <description> Apologies for cross-posting - some of you may be interested in the following Study Day organised by the ARLIS Committee for Art and Design Archives:<br><br>\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdArchivist as Curator: exhibiting collections, from conception to realization and review'<br>A study day exploring how to successfully exhibit archive material<br><br>When: Monday 9 June 2014, 10.30 - 17.00<br>Where: White Cube, 144-152 Bermondsey Street, London, SE1 3TQ<br>Cost: Waged - \ufffd\ufffd55 (\ufffd\ufffd45 ARLIS members); Unwaged - \ufffd\ufffd28 (\ufffd\ufffd23 ARLIS members)<br>Organised by: ARLIS UK &amp; Ireland Committee for Art and Design Archives<br>Programme: Speakers: Nayia Yiakoumaki, Whitechapel Gallery; Fiona Orsini, RIBA Archives/V&A; Meirian Jump, [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-05-03T20:30:33+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>ARLIS Committee for Art and Design Archives</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;98b8c229.1405</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;d2591184.1404">   <title>Call for proposals: In Dialogue symposium October 2014 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;d2591184.1404</link>   <description> In Dialogue, 2-4 October 2014<br>An International Symposium that interrogates how artists and researchers use dialogue in practice<br><br>In Dialogue 2014 is a series of interdisciplinary events including presentations, discussions, communal meals, open mic sessions, live music and performance/live art showcases taking place across Nottingham. Our aim is to create a dialogue between the different applications and understandings of the term 'In Dialogue', considering differences, commonalities, and how diverse approaches to understanding and articulating the theme can lead to new ways of thinking and making. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-04-25T16:30:14+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Heather Connelly</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENQUIRE;d2591184.1404</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
